016
017package imagingbook.parboiled.examples.calculators;
018
019import imagingbook.parboiled.support.Var;
020import imagingbook.parboiled.Rule;
021import imagingbook.parboiled.annotations.BuildParseTree;
022import imagingbook.parboiled.examples.calculators.CalculatorParser3.CalcNode;
023import imagingbook.parboiled.support.Var;
024
025/**
026 * A calculator parser defining the same language as the CalculatorParser3 but using a rule building helper methods
027 * to Factor out common constructs.
028 */
029@BuildParseTree
030public class CalculatorParser4 extends CalculatorParser<CalculatorParser3.CalcNode> {
031
032    @Override
033    public Rule InputLine() {
034        return Sequence(Expression(), EOI);
035    }
036
037    public Rule Expression() {
038        return OperatorRule(Term(), FirstOf("+ ", "- "));
039    }
040
041    public Rule Term() {
042        return OperatorRule(Factor(), FirstOf("* ", "/ "));
043    }
044
045    public Rule Factor() {
046        // by using toRule("^ ") instead of Ch('^') we make use of the fromCharLiteral(...) transformation below
047        return OperatorRule(Atom(), toRule("^ "));
048    }
049
050    public Rule OperatorRule(Rule subRule, Rule operatorRule) {
051        Var<Character> op = new Var<Character>();
052        return Sequence(
053                subRule,
054                ZeroOrMore(
055                        operatorRule, op.set(matchedChar()),
056                        subRule,
057                        push(new CalculatorParser3.CalcNode(op.get(), pop(1), pop()))
058                )
059        );
060    }
061
062    public Rule Atom() {
063        return FirstOf(Number(), SquareRoot(), Parens());
064    }
065
066    public Rule SquareRoot() {
067        return Sequence("SQRT", Parens(), push(new CalculatorParser3.CalcNode('R', pop(), null)));
068    }
069
070    public Rule Parens() {
071        return Sequence("( ", Expression(), ") ");
072    }
073
074    public Rule Number() {
075        return Sequence(
076                Sequence(
077                        Optional(Ch('-')),
078                        OneOrMore(Digit()),
079                        Optional(Ch('.'), OneOrMore(Digit()))
080                ),
081                // the action uses a default string in case it is run during error recovery (resynchronization)
082                push(new CalculatorParser3.CalcNode(Double.parseDouble(matchOrDefault("0")))),
083                WhiteSpace()
084        );
085    }
086
087    public Rule Digit() {
088        return CharRange('0', '9');
089    }
090
091    public Rule WhiteSpace() {
092        return ZeroOrMore(AnyOf(" \t\f"));
093    }
094
095    // we redefine the rule creation for string literals to automatically match trailing whitespace if the string
096    // literal ends with a space character, this way we don't have to insert extra whitespace() rules after each
097    // character or string literal
098    @Override
099    protected Rule fromStringLiteral(String string) {
100        return string.endsWith(" ") ?
101                Sequence(String(string.substring(0, string.length() - 1)), WhiteSpace()) :
102                String(string);
103    }
104
105    //**************** MAIN ****************
106
107    public static void main(String[] args) {
108        main(CalculatorParser4.class);
109    }
110}
